intro: Gnaphalium subrigidum, commonly known as the stiffleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow, stiff, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Gnaphalium subrigidum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
